players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Charlie was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
You: "Who found Charlie dead? Any last words or suspicions from them?"
Diana: "I investigated Bob last night — Bob is the mafioso. Arrest Bob."

Bob: "I didn't do it — I was out looking for Charlie and found the body first. Diana, claiming an immediate-investigate result like that on Day 1 is suspicious; why would you reveal a detective result so quickly and risk being targeted?"
Diana: "I told the truth — I investigated Bob last night and got mafioso. Charlie is dead; we need to arrest Bob now before mafia kills again."

You: "Bob's story about finding Charlie first could be true, but Diana revealing an instant investigation is risky if she's really detective. We should ask Diana: what time did you investigate and why reveal now? Bob, where exactly did you say you found the body?"

Bob: "I didn't kill Charlie. Diana's claim that she investigated me is convenient theatre — a real detective wouldn't announce results immediately and make themselves the target. Diana, if you're the detective, why waste your secrecy on Day 1 instead of gathering more confirmations? Alice, you asked where I found the body: I was by the market path near the well; I called out and Alice, you didn't respond because you were investigating details. Let's not rush to lynch me on one claim — we should ask Diana more specifics (time, who she investigated previously if any) before voting."
Votes: Alice voted for Diana, Bob voted for Alice, Diana voted for Bob
Bob was arrested
